    "number": 201820,
    "data": "0,1,3,4,6,7,8,11,12,13,14,15,17,19,20,21,22,25,28,29,32,34,39,40,42,45,47,50,52,53,55,57,59,63,64,67,68,70,76,78,84,85,87,90,95,96,97,99,102,103,105,108,109,110,112,113,116,119,122,123,125,129,131",
    "name": "Numbers n such that 90*n + 23 is prime.",
    "comment": [
        "This sequence was generated by adding 12 Fibonacci-like sequences. Looking at the format 90n+23 modulo 9 and modulo 10 we see that all entries of A142324 have digital root 5 and last digit 3. (Reverting the process is an application of the Chinese remainder theorem.)"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A201820/b201820.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>"
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = (A142324(n)-23)/90."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Select[Range[0,400],PrimeQ[90 #+23]&] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 11 2011 *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(MAGMA) [n: n in [0..200] | IsPrime(90*n+23)]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Dec 11 2011",
        "(PARI) is(n)=isprime(90*n+23) \\\\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 17 2017"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A181732, A198382, A195993, A196000, A196007, A201739, A201734, A201804, A201816, A201817, A201818."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "1,3",
    "author": "_J. W. Helkenberg_, Dec 05 2011",
    "references": 12,
    "revision": 17,
    "time": "2017-02-17T12:10:28-05:00",
